Docs.param: the context to use to create the db
the name of the db to create
the version to set on the db
the statements to use to populate the db. This should be a single string of the form returned by sqlite3's .dump command (statements separated by semicolons)
Docs.summary: Creates a db and populates it with the sql statements in sqlStatements.

.method public static hidebysig int64 QueryNumEntries(class Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db, string table, string selection) cil managed

Docs.param: A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will count all rows for the given table
the database the table is in
the name of the table to query
Docs.summary: Query the table for the number of rows in the table.
Docs.returns: the number of rows in the table

MemberSignature.Value: static member QueryNumEntries : Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteDatabase * string * string * string[] -> int64
public static long QueryNumEntries (Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteDatabase? db, string? table, string? selection, string[]? selectionArgs);
.method public static hidebysig int64 QueryNumEntries(class Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db, string table, string selection, string[] selectionArgs) cil managed

Docs.param: A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will count all rows for the given table
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
the database the table is in
the name of the table to query
Docs.summary: Query the table for the number of rows in the table.
Docs.returns: the number of rows in the table
